option.display: IWDT is automatically activated after a reset (Autostart mode)
NMI request or interrupt request is enabled
Stop counting when in Sleep, Snooze mode, or Software Standby
Automatically activate WDT after a reset (auto-start mode)
Stop WDT after a reset (register-start mode)
Stop counting when entering Sleep mode
Voltage monitor 0 reset is enabled after reset
Voltage monitor 0 reset is disabled after reset
HOCO oscillation is enabled after reset
HOCO oscillation is disabled after reset

property.display: MPU - Enable or disable PC Region 0

constraint.display: Value must be an integer between 0 and 0x000FFFFC (ROM) or between 0x1FF00000 and 0x200FFFFC (RAM)
Value must be an integer between 0x00000003 and 0x000FFFFF (ROM) or between 0x1FF00003 and 0x200FFFFF (RAM)

property.display: MPU - Enable or disable PC Region 1

constraint.display: Value must be an integer between 0 and 0x000FFFFC (ROM) or between 0x1FF00000 and 0x200FFFFC (RAM)
Value must be an integer between 0x00000003 and 0x000FFFFF (ROM) or between 0x1FF00003 and 0x200FFFFF (RAM)

property.display: MPU - Enable or disable Memory Region 0

constraint.display: Value must be an integer between 0 and 0x000FFFFC
Value must be an integer between 0x00000003 and 0x000FFFFF

property.display: MPU - Enable or disable Memory Region 1

constraint.display: Value must be an integer between 0x1FF00000 and 0x200FFFFC
Value must be an integer between 0x1FF00003 and 0x200FFFFF

property.display: MPU - Enable or disable Memory Region 2

constraint.display: Value must be an integer between 0x400C0000 and 0x400DFFFC or between 0x40100000 and 0x407FFFFC
Value must be an integer between 0x400C0003 and 0x400DFFFF or between 0x40100003 and 0x407FFFFF

property.display: MPU - Enable or disable Memory Region 3

constraint.display: Value must be an integer between 0x400C0000 and 0x400DFFFC or between 0x40100000 and 0x407FFFFC
Value must be an integer between 0x400C0003 and 0x400DFFFF or between 0x40100003 and 0x407FFFFF

option.display: Priority 3 (lowest - not valid if using ThreadX)
Priority 3 (lowest - not valid if using ThreadX)

constraint.display: ICLK must not be less than PCLKB
PCLKD must not be less than PCLKB

node.tooltip: Click to edit the XTAL frequency.
The system clock (ICLK) is used as the operating clock of the CPU, DMAC, DTC, ROM and RAM. \nIt should not exceed 32 MHz.
The Peripheral clock B (PCLKB) is used as the operating clock for all other modules not supported by PCLKA, PCLKC and PCLKD. \nIt should not exceed 32 MHz.
The Peripheral clock D (PCLKD) is used as the operating clock for the GPT module. \nIt should not exceed 64 MHz.
The USB clock (UCLK) is an operating clock for the USBFS module.\nA 48-MHz clock must be supplied to the USB module.\nWhen the USB module is used, setting must be made so that UCLK is 48 MHz.
